contradictions.description: At-risk mental health but poor foundational self-care (sleep/exercise/diet). Interventions less effective without basics.
contradictions.explanation: Therapy and medication work better with sleep/exercise/nutrition foundation. Can't out-therapy a terrible lifestyle.
contradictions.recommendation: While seeking professional help, prioritize: (1) 7-8h sleep, (2) 30min daily movement, (3) regular meals. These amplify treatment.

recommendations.advice: Create sustainable routine: set regular work hours (creativity needs structure), protect morning creative time, schedule client meetings in afternoon, batch similar tasks
recommendations.rationale: Freelance/agency creatives often have chaotic schedules. While flexibility is nice, routine enhances creative output and prevents burnout.
recommendations.job_specific: Track when you're most creative (morning/evening). Design ideal week template. Learn to estimate project time realistically (add 50%).

recommendations.advice: Set client boundaries: establish revision limits (e.g., 2 rounds), require consolidated feedback, educate clients on creative process, charge for scope creep
recommendations.rationale: Anxiety in creative work often stems from unclear expectations, endless revisions, or clients who don't respect expertise.
recommendations.job_specific: Use contracts with clear deliverables. Present 2-3 options max (not infinite revisions). Walk away from toxic clients - not worth mental health.

recommendations.advice: Schedule your next mental health check-in 2-4 weeks from now to establish trend data. Consistent tracking reveals patterns that single assessments miss.
recommendations.rationale: Mental health fluctuates. Tracking trends helps differentiate temporary stress from chronic issues, and validates that interventions are working.

insights: This is your first assessment. Future assessments will track trends.
